channel.title: [317] Web client tutorial! No custom sprites as I hate that!

item.title: [317] Web client tutorial! No custom sprites as I hate that!
item.dc:creator: @alex809 alex809
item.description:
@alex809 wrote:

Maximum ZxZ:

Is there a way to make a webclient working on a website where we can’t upload things ? Like InvisionFree or others.

Yea open up a webhosting account on something like x10hosting and then make a site that just looks legit and then have your applet code on your invisionfree board and have it search for everything remotely. In other words upload to like x10hosting make a page with the applet on your forums but instead of it looking for files on like “/rsps/” or whatever change it to “http://url.tld/” or wherever you uploaded the files so it finds the files and at least runs the client through iframe to your invisionfree board.

Its actually not hard at all.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Web client tutorial! No custom sprites as I hate that!

item.title: [317] Web client tutorial! No custom sprites as I hate that!
item.dc:creator: @Deltascape Deltascape
item.description:
@Deltascape wrote:

Once you done all that and jarred download dropbox make account and then in public folder click it paste the client.jar and cache there then get html code template and then right click on client click dropbox then click copy public link After that then get the html code and in applet paste the public link and you should be ready.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @K1ng_0f_K1ngs K1ng 0f K1ngs
item.description:
@K1ng_0f_K1ngs wrote:

[quote=“kingknight63, post:11, topic:282524”]euum i upload my client to uppit now and send it to you so u can chek if everything is ok in it
and can u put the client to my website? (so it connects)[/quote]

Yes of course I will. All you need to do is to send me the client link. Which includes you client.jar, and all of your .java files. Also you need to give me your website username & password! (As I can login and edit the html coding, as it adds your web client ;))
